FILE: cm713740v11.0.txt
DYAD: TAIWAN - JAPAN
RIVALRY: RIV1315
DISPUTE(S): MID3212 
RIVALRY: RIV1316
DISPUTE(S): MID4025 MID4026 

PS: 19720515-19950107 .5 19950108-20209999 .25

PSNOTES: relationship begins in 1972 when contiguity is established across the East China Sea with return of JPN sovereignty over Ryukyu Islands

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20190519
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20190519

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID3212

TERRMID: MID3212 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID3212 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3212 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID3212 3 -- uncertain
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3212 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, in 1955 China seized a Japanese ship in the waters near Taiwan. China and Taiwan were disputing the entirety of each other's territory, including each other's territorial waters. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to the China-Taiwan dispute. Coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped since Japan did not protest the seizure. 

MARITMID: MID3212 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3212 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3212 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3212 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3212 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3212 3 -- uncertain
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3212 The China-Taiwan dispute also has a civil war element. Coded civil war because Taiwan is in this dyad. Coded uncertain because GLM recommend that this case be dropped.

CIVWARLINK: MID3212 1 -- civil war link MID
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3212 3 -- uncertain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID3212 The China-Taiwan dispute also has a civil war element. Coded civil war link because China is outside this dyad. Coded uncertain because GLM recommend that this case be dropped.

COUPMID: MID3212 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3212 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3212 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3212 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4025

TERRMID: MID4025 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4025 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4025 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4025 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4025 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4025 3 -- uncertain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4025 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, a Taiwanese ship entered Japanese waters to pursue a smuggling ship. Japan accused Taiwan of violating their waters, and Taiwan admitted they did and said that they were tracking smugglers. Coded not maritime because Taiwan was not contesting Japan's maritime boundary, and coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped since Japan did not protest. 

ISLMID: MID4025 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4025 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4025 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4025 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4025 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4025 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4025 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4025 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4025 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4025 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4026

TERRMID: MID4026 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4026 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4026 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4026 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4026 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4026 3 -- uncertain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4026 coded maritime MID because the island was disputed due to maritime boundary implications, and coded uncertain because Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016 recommend this case be dropped. 

ISLMID: MID4026 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID4026 3 -- uncertain
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4026 from Gibler, Miller, and Little 2016, a Taiwanese citizen was sailing toward a disputed island when a Japanese ship turned it away. Taiwanese civilians repeatedly try to sail to the disputed island and destroy a lighthouse that Japan had built. Coded islands MID because this was connected to a diputed island, and coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped, since it was civilians and not anyone acting on behalf of the Taiwanese government. 

CIVWARMID: MID4026 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4026 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4026 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4026 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4026 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4026 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4026 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4026 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4454

TERRMID: MID4454 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4454 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4454 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4454 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4454 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4454 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4454 from Gibler 2018, in 2003 Japan naval vessels ordered a group of Taiwanese fishermen in disputed waters to vacate the area. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime dispute. 

ISLMID: MID4454 3 -- not islands
ISLMID-CER: MID4454 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4454 although there were disputed islands present in the disputed waters, the disputed islands are not involved in this MID. The islands are disputed due to their maritime boundary implications. 

CIVWARMID: MID4454 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4454 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4454 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4454 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4454 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4454 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4454 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4454 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4470

TERRMID: MID4470 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4470 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4470 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4470 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4470 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4470 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4470 from Gibler 2018, in 2005 Taiwan sent naval warships to the disputed waters around the dyad's disputed islands to protect Taiwanese fishermen there. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime dispute. 

ISLMID: MID4470 3 -- not islands
ISLMID-CER: MID4470 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4470 although there were disputed islands present in the disputed waters, the disputed islands are not involved in this MID. The islands are disputed due to their maritime boundary implications. 

CIVWARMID: MID4470 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4470 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4470 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4470 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID4470 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK-CER: MID4470 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4482

TERRMID: MID4482 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4482 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4482 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4482 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4482 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4482 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4482 from Gibler 2018, in 2008 Taiwan sent a survey ship and naval vessels into the dyad's disputed waters. Coded maritime MID because this was connected to a maritime dispute. 

ISLMID: MID4482 3 -- not islands
ISLMID-CER: MID4482 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4482 although there were disputed islands present in the disputed waters, the disputed islands are not involved in this MID. The islands are disputed due to their maritime boundary implications. 

CIVWARMID: MID4482 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4482 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4482 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4482 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4482 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4482 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4482 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4482 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4492

TERRMID: MID4492 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4492 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4492 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4492 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4492 1 -- maritime MID
MARITMID-CER: MID4492 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: MID4492 coded maritime MID because the Senkaku Islands were disputed due to their maritime boundary implications. 

ISLMID: MID4492 1 -- islands MID
ISLMID-CER: MID4492 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: MID4492 from cm narrative and Gibler 2018, in 2010 a Taiwanese fishing ship was carrying activists to the disputed Senkaku Islands, and Japan sent a naval vessel to stop them. Coded islands MID because this was connected to disputed islands. 

CIVWARMID: MID4492 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4492 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4492 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4492 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4492 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4492 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4492 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4492 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4 2002-2010:

MID4454
rivalry=713740 nationa=JAPAN nationb=TAIWAN MID4454 20030213-20030213 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0 lhostb=
NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

Japan dispersed dozens of Taiwanese fishermen in a disputed area of the East China Sea. Both Japan and Taiwan claim the area as exclusive fishing sectors for their respective countries. First day of dispute was on 2/12/2003 and last day of dispute was on 2/12/2003.

MID4470
rivalry=713740 nationa=TAIWAN nationb=JAPAN MID4470 20050615-20050710 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=TERRITORY fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0 lhostb=
NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

Taiwan repeatedly deployed naval vessels to the waters around the Senkaku Islands, an area of water disputed with Japan (see MID4457), to protect its fishermen from harassment by Japanese naval vessels. First day of dispute was on 6/15/2005 and last day of dispute was on 7/10/2005.

MID4482
rivalry=713740 nationa=TAIWAN nationb=JAPAN MID4482 20080616-20080616 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0 lhostb=
NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

A Tawianese survey boat, accompanied by several Taiwanese naval warships, entered Japanese waters near the disputed Senkaku Islands, where they remained undisturbed before leaving several hours later. First day of dispute was on 6/16/2008 and last day of dispute was on 6/16/2008.

MID4492
rivalry=713740 nationa=JAPAN nationb=TAIWAN MID4492 20100914-20100914 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0 lhostb=
NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

When a Taiwanese fishing boat occupied by activists approached the Senkaku islands, Japan deployed 11 naval warships to turn the boat around. First day of dispute was on 9/14/2010 and last day of dispute was on 9/14/2010.

MID3 1993-2001:

MID4025
rivalry=713740 nationa=TAIWAN nationb=JAPAN MID4025 19950108-19950108 
 revtype1a=TERRITORY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0 lhostb=
NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

The dispute is about a Taiwanese patrol boat which entered Japanese waters while chasing a smuggling vessel. Japan protested Taiwan's border violation, but Taiwanstated that it did not recognize Japanese sovereignty over the Ryukyu Archipelago (Okinawa Islands). First and last day of dispute was on 1/8/1995.

MID4026
rivalry=713740 nationa=JAPAN nationb=TAIWAN MID4026 19960904-19960906 
 revtype1a=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=TERRITORY revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0 lhostb=
NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

This dispute is based on a show of force by Japan to Taiwan. Japanese patrol boats blocked attempts by Taiwanese civilian boats to enter the waters surrounding the Senkaku Islands twice. On 9/4/96, Japanese boats prevented Hong Kong journalists aboard on a Taiwanese charter boat from entry. On 9/6/96, Japanese patrol boats turned back a ship sailing with a Taiwanese lawmaker. First day of dispute was on 9/4/1996 and last day of dispute was on 9/6/1996.

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield. 

Gibler, D. M., S. V. Miller, and E. K. Little. 2016. "An Analysis of the Militarized Interstate Dispute (MID) Dataset, 1816-2001." International Studies Quarterly. 60 (4): 719-730.
